alert.note: Alert for Shannon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 31 at 6:07AM CDT until March 31 at 1:13PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Missouri... Jacks Fork at Eminence affecting Shannon County. Jacks Fork at Alley Spring affecting Shannon County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Jacks Fork at Alley Spring. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, water impacts Alley Spring Campground. Water is one foot in depth at the 600, 800 and 900 loop camp sites. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 9.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:30 AM CDT Thursday was 11.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this morning and continue falling to 3.7 feet early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.6 feet on 04/28/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Many flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 115 PM CDT.
